festival.introText:
bluedot is a truly unique festival taking place at Jodrell Bank, the iconic observatory at the heart of humanity’s quest for discovery.

This experience invites you to explore a stellar programme of music, science, arts, technology, culture and film and discover a festival unlike any other on Earth.

bluedot's mission is to entertain and inspire through a series of ground breaking live performances, DJ sets, talks, workshops, experiments, exhibitions and experiences.

bludot returns 20th-23rd July 2023!

Following two years of postponements, the award-winning intergalactic music, science and culture festival, bluedot (21 - 24 July ’22) – made a triumphant return in 2022.

Headlining Sunday evening with a UK Festival Exclusive and uniquely commissioned performance alongside Manchester’s famed Halle Orchestra was international superstar Björk.

Legendary Scottish post-rockers Mogwai headlined Saturday night at bluedot 2022 alongside Indie-electro giants, Metronomy whilst one of the best-loved dance acts, Groove Armada closed Friday night.

The stellar line-up also saw Spiritualized, Yard Act, Working Mens Club, A Certain Ratio, Tim Burgess, Squarepusher and Anna Meredith amongst many more acts. 

bluedot has also had headline names from its science programme for 2022. Key speakers included host of Radio 4’s The Life Scientific Professor Jim Al-Khalili, British historian and filmmaker David Olusoga, leading space scientist Monica Grady, and astrophysicist and host of BBC’s The Sky at Night Chris Lintott.
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of bluedot 2023. Get bluedot Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body:
Organisers need to plan more if things stop working, it rains a lot or other issues. On the Friday, the system letting people enter broke for half an hour. Seems that they hadn’t tested for this. 
When it rained heavily, there seemed to be no idea of how to deal with the muddy paths and when leaving the site on Monday many people struggled to get their vehicles out and there was no communication as to how you could get help. When you did get help, the security people were rude and unhelpful.
Because of these issues I don’t think I’d go back. Shame really because it is a great place and great line up. The organisers need to grow up in thinking of how things could go wrong and how they will deal with it because it was apparent at the weekend they simply hadn’t done the planning and lots of staff had to say sorry because things weren’t working. Please get your act together as you’ve a venue way better than Glastonbury and other venues.

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body: Waited 4 decades to see Kraftwerk.... they were mind blowing and the sound quality across the festival was  faultless

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body:
fantastic event as always. great music. learned loads. great range of food.  app works really well. loved the pre pay wristbands too. so much easier!

 only improvement suggestion:  organise camping space better and have an opt-in quiet zone .... or an opt in party zone ... so that entire site is not at the mercy of karioke and drnken revelry all night.

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body: Very chilled lots of different evants

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body: Incredible weekend - I'm dying to go back already!

reviews.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviews.body: Poor organisation of the parking facilities & over expensive parking but other than that quite good value.

faqs.question: When is bluedot 2023?
faqs.answer: bluedot returns to Jodrell Bank Observatory from Thursday 20th July to Sunday 23rd July 2023.

faqs.question: How much are bluedot tickets?
faqs.answer: Adult weekend camping tickets start from £158, with 11-15 years starting from £87 and 6-10 years at £27.50. Children under 5 go free.

faqs.question: How do I get to bluedot?
faqs.answer:
By Car - The festival site is approximately 30 minutes from Manchester City Centre and 50 minutes from Liverpool city Centre. 

 

By Coach - Tuned In Travel is the partner travel company, supplying coaches from Manchester, Sheffield, Stockport, Chester, London – Friday Only, Chorlton, Fallowfield – Friday Only, Liverpool, Macclesfield and Warrington. 

 

By Rail - We recommend travelling to Macclesfield train station, from Manchester the journey will take 20 minutes and London 1 hour and 45 minutes.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer:
bluedot Festival are proud to have been awarded the Silver level of Attitude is Everything’s Charter of Best Practice, demonstrating their commitment to improving the live music experience for their deaf and disabled customers.

If you would like more information on the access facilities at the event please email access@discoverthebluedot.com. The festival will respond to all enquiries within 5 working days.

If you need to send anything by post, please send it to this address:

Bluedot Access Team
Office 102
19 Lever Street
Manchester
M1 1AN

Bluedot is a four-day festival set in the beautiful Cheshire countryside. The festival work closely with Attitude is Everything to provide an event site, which is accessible.

Please note: The accessibility facilities are reserved to festival goers with disabilities so unfortunately broken legs, recent injuries, recent operations, elderly and pregnant women do not qualify.

faqs.question: Does bluedot have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
Yes, bluedot has on-site camping. There are varied options of camping available to suit all needs.

bluedot is made up of six campsites consisting of:

  • Standard Camping

  • Family Camping (a family-only area located within the standard campsite)

  • Tangerine Fields (pre-pitched dome tents located with the standard campsite)

  • Live-In Vehicles

  • Accessible Camping

  • The Colony – Boutique Camping

Camping is only available with a weekend ticket and standard campsites are included in the price of your ticket. For all campsites excluding pre-bookings (boutique, Tangerine Fields and live in vehicles) spaces are on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Where is bluedot?
faqs.answer: Bluedot is located in Cheshire as part of Manchester University, The Jodrell Bank Observatory. The postcode to take you directly to the site is SK11 9DW.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket to bluedot and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does bluedot have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Bluedot Festival is suitable for all ages with plenty of science and art activities for the family to enjoy. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: How do I access my bludot tickets?
faqs.answer: Depending on your delivery method (RaidScan or Posted) you can view your order at any time in your order history or the 'my tickets' section of the Skiddle app. From here you will be able to check the status of your delivery or access your RapidScan tickets.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into bluedot?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to bring food and drink to the campsite however you are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into the festival site. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival, serving up organic, vegetarian and vegan options.

faqs.question: What are the set times at bluedot?
faqs.answer: The set times are generally released on the first day of the festival.

location.address: Jodrell Bank Observatory, Jodrell Bank, Lower Withington

fantastic event as always. great music. learned loads. great range of food.  app works really well. loved the pre pay wristbands too. so much easier!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Incredible weekend - I'm dying to go back already!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
Excellent festival. Great vibe. Small enough to feel intimate. But big enough to have lots going on.
And can't p beat the location, underneath routes the Lovell telescope

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival 2019
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Bluedot is such a enlightening and enjoyable festival with something for all ages

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Loved the Bluedot Festival and would definitely go next year for the 50th Anniversary special of the Moon Landings. Great atmosphere and just the right size for a festival. Not too big and not too small. Felt very safe with the stewards around and a great  festival for all the family and all ages with a mixture of everything. Loved the science lectures on SETI and Aliens, the films of Moon and Metropolis and the music, wellbeing area and fire garden. THANK YOU Bluedot! Until next year!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
Great w/e.
Bit pricey on drinks.
Staff, music & atmosphere great

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Best festival that I have ever been too

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Brilliant weekend. Great music. Interesting science and a wonderful location.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Bluedot Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: An excellent festival, full of good vibes due to the location, the lovely family atmosphere, unique programme and great food. Seeing Orbital there this year was a real highlight. I hope they can keep booking such quality acts in future so we can make a weekend of it.

news.title: Bluedot Festival reveals huge lineup of music and activities
news.summary: Cheshires Bluedot Festival reveals multi-genre lineup of artists along with family, science, art, and culture activities.
